info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 3:40PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Hart, southwestern Anderson and southeastern Oconee Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 339 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Seneca, or 6 miles northeast of Tugaloo State Park, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Seneca, Northlake, Reed Creek, Anderson Airport, Lake Hartwell, Pendleton, Townville, Sandy Springs, Fair Play and Oakway. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
